intro: Polhillia waltersii, commonly known as the Walter's polhillia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists around the world.
